revised_title: The Locomotor System of Echinodermata: Observations on Ambulacral System and Echinus
tldr: The authors examine the locomotor system of echinodermata, specifically the ambulacral system in Holothuria and the structures in Echinus. They describe the polian vesicle, circular canal, tentacle sinuses, radial canals, and pedicels, as well as the role of the perivisceral fluid and the cloacal valve in the locomotion of these creatures.
